subject: Re: [junit] How to test a method that logs to a file
msgSnippet: I prefer to separate the notification of significant events from the logging (or other handling) of those events.  It s easy to test the notification with mock
messageBody:
I prefer to separate the notification of significant events from the logging
(or other handling) of those events. It's easy to test the notification
with mock objects and then wire the notifications into a logging system in
the production system.

More info about doing this (in C#) at
http://nat.truemesh.com/archives/000488.html.
And an easy way to implement notifications in Java at
http://nat.truemesh.com/archives/000710.html.

--Nat
